com.poesys.db.dao
Class MemcachedDaoManager

java.lang.Object
  com.poesys.db.dao.MemcachedDaoManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDaoManager
public final class MemcachedDaoManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDaoManager

A singleton object that manages data access objects in the system. This implementation of the DAO Manager enables the use of memcached, a distributed cache system. This class contains the actual calls to the xmemcached Java memcached client, implementing the Bridge design pattern to wrap the xmemcached API. It also contains the DTO registry that contains the de-serialized Java objects currently being retrieved. This registry prevents infinite loops and object duplication during serialization of nested object hierarchies by checking the registry for objects before getting them from the external cache, so that once an object is retrieved, that tree branch will not be duplicated by a later cache query.

You should minimize the lifetime of the Java DTOs retrieved from the cache after completion of a query. The longer you hold these objects, the more likely it is they will be duplicated in memory allocated by different queries and the more likely it is for them to go stale. If the DTO is read only, the lifetime is not critical, but for read/write DTOs, you should get rid of the Java objects as soon as you can after using the data they contain. Then memcached will be the source for the most current data, and if it's not there, you will get it from the ultimate source, the database.

Because this is a singleton, all cache methods are synchronized. This means that throughput must wait for a session operation to complete before undertaking a new one. This guarantees the operation is atomic and consistent in the presence of multiple threads accessing the cache. Also, the client comes from a client pool and is released back to the pool entirely within each method. This reduces the number of connection requests to memcached but preserves flexibility in getting clients.

Author:
Robert J. Muller
See Also:
DaoMemcachedFactory

getInstance

public static IDaoManager getInstance()
Get the singleton instance of the IDaoManager for a memcached cache.

Returns:

getFactory

public <T extends IDbDto,C extends java.util.Collection<T>> IDaoFactory<T> getFactory(java.lang.String name,
                                                                                      java.lang.String subsystem,
                                                                                      java.lang.Integer expiration)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
Get a DAO factory of an appropriate type based on the implementation. A DAO factory is an Abstract Factory that generates various kinds of data-access-related objects relating to DTOs of a particular type.

Specified by:
getFactory in interface IDaoManager
Type Parameters:
T - the type of IDbDto that the factory caches
C - the type of collection used for inserting the DTOs
Parameters:
name - the class name of the object that the DAO processes, used for naming a potential cache of such objects; the name may be null if the system does not cache objects.
subsystem - the name of the subsystem that contains the class T
expiration - the time in milliseconds that an object remains cached; 0 means expire immediately, and the default is MAX_INT
Returns:
the DAO factory
See Also:
IDaoFactory, IDbDto

getClient

private net.rubyeye.xmemcached.MemcachedClient getClient()
                                                  throws DbErrorException,
                                                         java.io.IOException,
                                                         net.rubyeye.xmemcached.exception.MemcachedException
Get a xmemcached client from the client pool. If there are no clients available, the pool manager will throw a database exception.

Returns:
an xmemcached client
Throws:
java.io.IOException - when there is a problem creating an xmemcached client
DbErrorException - when the client pool is exhausted
net.rubyeye.xmemcached.exception.MemcachedException - when the properties file specifies an unknown protocol (binary or text are the possible values)

checkClient

private void checkClient(net.rubyeye.xmemcached.MemcachedClient client)
Check that the client exists and throw an appropriate runtime exception if not.

Parameters:
client - the client to check

releaseClient

private void releaseClient(net.rubyeye.xmemcached.MemcachedClient client)
Release a client back to the client pool. This makes the memcached connection available for use by other tasks.

Parameters:
client - the client to release.

Log the meta data, if there are any, for the data-access scheme. Cache meta data includes any descriptive information likely to be of use in the implemented caching scheme.

Specified by:

isCached

public boolean isCached(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager

Is a class of IDbDto objects (identified by fully qualified class name) cached in memory?

Note: a distributed caching scheme may cache the objects of the class but not the class, in which case this method returns false, as there is no need for the information. >/p>

Specified by:
isCached in interface IDaoManager
Parameters:
name - the fully qualified class name
Returns:
true if the system caches objects of the class, false if not

clearCache

public void clearCache(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
Clear the cache of objects specified by a fully qualified class name. This will clear the cache only if the caching scheme has a way to identify the objects of a specific class. If there is no caching, this method does nothing.

Specified by:
clearCache in interface IDaoManager
Parameters:
name - the fully qualified name of the cached class

createCache

public <T extends IDbDto> IDtoCache<T> createCache(java.lang.String name)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
Create a cache of IDbDto objects of class T with a specified name. If the manager is not a caching manager, or if the caching scheme in the implementation does not implement class-specific caching, this method returns null.

Specified by:
createCache in interface IDaoManager
Type Parameters:
T - the specific class of object contained in the cache
Parameters:
name - the fully qualified name of the cached class T
Returns:
the new cache of objects of type T or null if the implementation is not a class-caching manager

getCachedObject

public <T extends IDbDto> T getCachedObject(IPrimaryKey key)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
Get an object identified by a primary key out of a named cache. The object may be of any type. The cache name is optional for caching systems that do not have separate caches for each class.

Specified by:
getCachedObject in interface IDaoManager
Type Parameters:
T - the type of object to look up
Parameters:
key - the unique identifier of the object you want to retrieve; also contains the cache name for in-memory cache lookup
Returns:
the object

putObjectInCache

public <T extends IDbDto> void putObjectInCache(java.lang.String cacheName,
                                                int expireTime,
                                                T object)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
Put an object into a named cache. The object may be of any type. The cache name is optional for caching systems that do not have separate caches for each class. The expire time tells the cache manager to remove the object from the cache after the specified number of milliseconds; 0 means expire the object immediately, MAX_INT will keep it as long as possible. The default value is MAX_INT.

Specified by:
putObjectInCache in interface IDaoManager
Type Parameters:
T - the type of object to cache
Parameters:
cacheName - the name of the class cache
expireTime - the milliseconds until the object expires from the cache
object - the object to cache

removeObjectFromCache

public void removeObjectFromCache(java.lang.String cacheName,
                                  IPrimaryKey key)
Description copied from interface: IDaoManager
Remove an object specified by a primary key from the object cache. The cacheName will be null if there are no separate caches for different classes.

Specified by:
removeObjectFromCache in interface IDaoManager
Parameters:
cacheName - the name of the cache from which to remove the object
key - the unique identifier for the object
